nse_queries.observation: On page no. 1, it is mentioned the disclosure regarding unnamed foreign entities. The Company mentions foreign business partner(s) without providing complete names and details. Kindly provide: (a) complete name and registration details of such entity; (b) nature and terms of business arrangement; (c) dependency analysis and alternate arrangements, if any. Provide revised draft along with confirmation that the same shall be updated in prospectus.

If the narrative mentions the sku count as 2.0 on page 23 but the Table/another section reflects 5.0 on page 26, kindly reconcile the factual contradiction and provide revised draft of the table along with confirmation that the same shall be updated in prospectus

In “Our Business” chapter- It is observed that the Company has made use of superlative words / adjectives like “Seasoned”, “comprehensive”, “experienced”, “extensive”, “high-quality”, “significant”, “superior”, “trusted” etc. without citing the source and basis of the same as per the instructions mentioned in Schedule VI of the SEBI (ICDR) Regulations 2018 in relation to forward-looking statements. Kindly provide the source/basis of all such statements/claims. Also include these bases in the Material Documents Chapter available for inspection. If not, kindly review and revise the same. Further, the above mentioned points are merely indicative in nature, the Merchant banker shall vet the offer document and ensure that there are no disclosures which are advertising statements and marketing statement and if there are any it shall be either be drafted in a neutral language or provide a basis for the same or removed, to that end, kindly provide a draft along with a confirmation the same shall be placed at the time of prospectus as applicable

[Critical - Operational] Throughout the Chapter (specifically on Page(s) 7), the disclosure states "With most processes handled in-house, we minimize reliance on third-party vendors". Quantify the ratio of in-house versus outsourced costs for key manufacturing processes and provide the percentage of total manufacturing cost represented by third-party vendors. However, a breakdown of the logistics mechanism, specifically the cost ratio between in-house logistics and outsourced logistics for the last three financial years and the stub period ending December 2024, is not provided. Provide revised draft...

[Critical - Operational] Throughout the Chapter (specifically on Page 154), the DRHP describes various product applications including "air filtration systems", "oil filtration", "thermal/heat insulation", "acoustic/sound insulation", "felt parts", "angle cutting parts", "foam tubing", "heat shield/thermal jackets", and "aluminium laminated foam parts". However, there is no explicit mention or quantification of the Company's R&D spend in relation to these product categories, nor is there a 3-year trend analysis of R&D spend as a percentage of revenue. [Critical - Operational] The disclosure on Page 16 outlines a detailed process for foam processing, including "Band Saw Strip Cutting", "Foam Loading", "Forming", "Curing", "Demoulding", "De-flashing", and "Final Inspection". However, there is no mention of the specific R&D expenditure allocated to optimizing these processes, nor is there a trend analysis of R&D spend as a percentage of revenue over the last three financial years and the stub period ending December 2024.

On page no. 8, it is mentioned specialized equipment. Kindly elaborate and explain the statement 'Custom Machinery for International Clients'. Clarify the CAPEX and timeline for the same. Provide revised draft.

nse_queries.text: On page 9, the Company mentions business partner without providing the name. Kindly provide the complete name of the business partner. Provide revised draft along with confirmation that the same shall be updated in the prospectus.

nse_queries.observation: Provide the RPT summary table for the last 3 FYs including counterparties and amounts, or confirm if none exist.

On page no. 24, there appears to be a numerical inconsistency regarding CUSTOMERS. The disclosure mentions conflicting values: 7 vs 8 vs 9 vs 10. Kindly reconcile this factual contradiction and provide revised draft along with confirmation that the same shall be updated in the final prospectus.

On page no. 20, dependency is mentioned: 'based on actual production during the relevant fiscal year / period divided
                                 '. Kindly disclose: (a) % of revenue/operations dependent on this factor; (b) historical instances of disruption (if any) and quantified impact; (c) mitigation measures with timeline and cost; and (d) a specific Risk Factor. Provide revised draft.

On page no. 6, acronym(s) 'ICE' appear without definition. Kindly provide full form on first occurrence or in glossary/abbreviations section. Provide revised draft.
On page no. 7, acronym(s) 'IATF, ISO' appear without definition. Kindly provide full form on first occurrence or in glossary/abbreviations section. Provide revised draft.

On page no. 12, acronym(s) 'GIN, FIFO' appear without definition. Kindly provide full form on first occurrence or in glossary/abbreviations section. Provide revised draft.
On page no. 13, acronym(s) 'PU' appear without definition. Kindly provide full form on first occurrence or in glossary/abbreviations section. Provide revised draft.
On page no. 16, acronym(s) 'FIFO' appear without definition. Kindly provide full form on first occurrence or in glossary/abbreviations section. Provide revised draft.
On page no. 29, footnote symbol '*' appears unreferenced. Kindly ensure all footnotes are properly cross-referenced (both in-text reference and footnote definition). Provide revised draft.

Refer to the property section on page 7, kindly include the area details (i.e. sq.ft., sq. meters, acres etc.) for all properties (owned and leased). Provide this in the property table along with: (a) built-up area; (b) land area; (c) unit of measurement; and (d) usage (manufacturing/office/warehouse). Provide revised draft.

Refer to page 27, kindly provide rationale for not including certain revenue segments (e.g., consumer durables, appliances, etc.) details in the competition section, if these segments contribute materially to revenue. If these segments are not material, provide disclosure confirming the same. Provide revised draft.
